area_name: Have a Little Help From My Friends Wall

content.description: This is a little run out to the second bolt, but it has good, consistent climbing.
content.protection: Mixed. Bring up to a hand-sized piece.  6 bolts.
content.location: It is the leftmost route.  This could use a direct start if someone is feeling motivated.

climbs.name: Rally Round the Red, Gold, Black, and Green.

content.description: An easy start leads to some serious crimping.
content.protection: Bring some small cams if desired or make it more exciting with 6 well placed bolts.
content.location: It is on the right side of the crag just right of Africa.  This used to have a red, gold, black, and then green bolt.  The anchor may still have Rasta colors.

content.description: This is the best route on the wall.  This climb has a lot of variation including a short hand crack section at the top!
content.protection: Mixed to a hand-sized piece, 9 bolts.
content.location: It is right in the middle of the crag.  Look for the large feature that looks like Africa and start just left of it. Or look high up for the rock that looks like Illinois (Tim's home state) and start just left.

content.description: This is a fun, consistent route.
content.protection: Mixed.  5 bolts, small to hand-sized gear.
content.location:
It is on the left side of the wall and shares a start with "

Rep Your Click

." The first few moves are protected with trad gear.

content.description: This has a fun roof with jugs.  You can bail out right at the top if you like.  It is a good warm up for this area.
content.protection: Mixed.  Bring protection up to a hand-sized piece.  4 bolts.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the crag.

pathTokens: Have a Little Help From My Friends Wall
